\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03752}03752 \textcolor{comment}{/*  Font handling in this library was designed to be quite customizable and lets}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03753}03753 \textcolor{comment}{    you decide what you want to use and what you want to provide. There are three}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03754}03754 \textcolor{comment}{    different ways to use the font atlas. The first two will use your font}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03755}03755 \textcolor{comment}{    handling scheme and only requires essential data to run nuklear. The next}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03756}03756 \textcolor{comment}{    slightly more advanced features is font handling with vertex buffer output.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03757}03757 \textcolor{comment}{    Finally the most complex API wise is using nuklear's font baking API.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03758}03758 \textcolor{comment}{}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03759}03759 \textcolor{comment}{    1.) Using your own implementation without vertex buffer output}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03760}03760 \textcolor{comment}{    -\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03761}03761 \textcolor{comment}{    So first up the easiest way to do font handling is by just providing a}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03762}03762 \textcolor{comment}{    `nk\_user\_font` struct which only requires the height in pixel of the used}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03763}03763 \textcolor{comment}{    font and a callback to calculate the width of a string. This way of handling}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03764}03764 \textcolor{comment}{    fonts is best fitted for using the normal draw shape command API where you}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03765}03765 \textcolor{comment}{    do all the text drawing yourself and the library does not require any kind}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03766}03766 \textcolor{comment}{    of deeper knowledge about which font handling mechanism you use.}}

\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03828}03828 \textcolor{comment}{    The final approach if you do not have a font handling functionality or don't}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03829}03829 \textcolor{comment}{    want to use it in this library is by using the optional font baker.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03830}03830 \textcolor{comment}{    The font baker APIs can be used to create a font plus font atlas texture}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03831}03831 \textcolor{comment}{    and can be used with or without the vertex buffer output.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03832}03832 \textcolor{comment}{}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03833}03833 \textcolor{comment}{    It still uses the `nk\_user\_font` struct and the two different approaches}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03834}03834 \textcolor{comment}{    previously stated still work. The font baker is not located inside}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03835}03835 \textcolor{comment}{    `nk\_context` like all other systems since it can be understood as more of}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03836}03836 \textcolor{comment}{    an extension to nuklear and does not really depend on any `nk\_context` state.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03837}03837 \textcolor{comment}{}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03838}03838 \textcolor{comment}{    Font baker need to be initialized first by one of the nk\_font\_atlas\_init\_xxx}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03839}03839 \textcolor{comment}{    functions. If you don't care about memory just call the default version}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03840}03840 \textcolor{comment}{    `nk\_font\_atlas\_init\_default` which will allocate all memory from the standard library.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03841}03841 \textcolor{comment}{    If you want to control memory allocation but you don't care if the allocated}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03842}03842 \textcolor{comment}{    memory is temporary and therefore can be freed directly after the baking process}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03843}03843 \textcolor{comment}{    is over or permanent you can call `nk\_font\_atlas\_init`.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03844}03844 \textcolor{comment}{}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03845}03845 \textcolor{comment}{    After successfully initializing the font baker you can add Truetype(.ttf) fonts from}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03846}03846 \textcolor{comment}{    different sources like memory or from file by calling one of the `nk\_font\_atlas\_add\_xxx`.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03847}03847 \textcolor{comment}{    functions. Adding font will permanently store each font, font config and ttf memory block(!)}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03848}03848 \textcolor{comment}{    inside the font atlas and allows to reuse the font atlas. If you don't want to reuse}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03849}03849 \textcolor{comment}{    the font baker by for example adding additional fonts you can call}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03850}03850 \textcolor{comment}{    `nk\_font\_atlas\_cleanup` after the baking process is over (after calling nk\_font\_atlas\_end).}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03851}03851 \textcolor{comment}{}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03852}03852 \textcolor{comment}{    As soon as you added all fonts you wanted you can now start the baking process}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03853}03853 \textcolor{comment}{    for every selected glyph to image by calling `nk\_font\_atlas\_bake`.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03854}03854 \textcolor{comment}{    The baking process returns image memory, width and height which can be used to}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03855}03855 \textcolor{comment}{    either create your own image object or upload it to any graphics library.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03856}03856 \textcolor{comment}{    No matter which case you finally have to call `nk\_font\_atlas\_end` which}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03857}03857 \textcolor{comment}{    will free all temporary memory including the font atlas image so make sure}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03858}03858 \textcolor{comment}{    you created our texture beforehand. `nk\_font\_atlas\_end` requires a handle}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03859}03859 \textcolor{comment}{    to your font texture or object and optionally fills a `struct nk\_draw\_null\_texture`}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03860}03860 \textcolor{comment}{    which can be used for the optional vertex output. If you don't want it just}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03861}03861 \textcolor{comment}{    set the argument to `NULL`.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03862}03862 \textcolor{comment}{}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03863}03863 \textcolor{comment}{    At this point you are done and if you don't want to reuse the font atlas you}}

\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l03866}03866 \textcolor{comment}{    you need to call `nk\_font\_atlas\_clear` to free all memory still being used.}}

\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04060}04060 \textcolor{comment}{/* ==============================================================}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04061}04061 \textcolor{comment}{ *}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04062}04062 \textcolor{comment}{ *                          MEMORY BUFFER}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04063}04063 \textcolor{comment}{ *}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04064}04064 \textcolor{comment}{ * ===============================================================*/}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04065}04065 \textcolor{comment}{/*  A basic (double)-\/buffer with linear allocation and resetting as only}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04066}04066 \textcolor{comment}{    freeing policy. The buffer's main purpose is to control all memory management}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04067}04067 \textcolor{comment}{    inside the GUI toolkit and still leave memory control as much as possible in}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04068}04068 \textcolor{comment}{    the hand of the user while also making sure the library is easy to use if}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04069}04069 \textcolor{comment}{    not as much control is needed.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04070}04070 \textcolor{comment}{    In general all memory inside this library can be provided from the user in}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04071}04071 \textcolor{comment}{    three different ways.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04072}04072 \textcolor{comment}{}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04073}04073 \textcolor{comment}{    The first way and the one providing most control is by just passing a fixed}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04074}04074 \textcolor{comment}{    size memory block. In this case all control lies in the hand of the user}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04075}04075 \textcolor{comment}{    since he can exactly control where the memory comes from and how much memory}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04076}04076 \textcolor{comment}{    the library should consume. Of course using the fixed size API removes the}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04077}04077 \textcolor{comment}{    ability to automatically resize a buffer if not enough memory is provided so}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04078}04078 \textcolor{comment}{    you have to take over the resizing. While being a fixed sized buffer sounds}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04079}04079 \textcolor{comment}{    quite limiting, it is very effective in this library since the actual memory}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04080}04080 \textcolor{comment}{    consumption is quite stable and has a fixed upper bound for a lot of cases.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04081}04081 \textcolor{comment}{}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04082}04082 \textcolor{comment}{    If you don't want to think about how much memory the library should allocate}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04083}04083 \textcolor{comment}{    at all time or have a very dynamic UI with unpredictable memory consumption}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04084}04084 \textcolor{comment}{    habits but still want control over memory allocation you can use the dynamic}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04085}04085 \textcolor{comment}{    allocator based API. The allocator consists of two callbacks for allocating}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04086}04086 \textcolor{comment}{    and freeing memory and optional userdata so you can plugin your own allocator.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04087}04087 \textcolor{comment}{}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04088}04088 \textcolor{comment}{    The final and easiest way can be used by defining}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04089}04089 \textcolor{comment}{    NK\_INCLUDE\_DEFAULT\_ALLOCATOR which uses the standard library memory}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04090}04090 \textcolor{comment}{    allocation functions malloc and free and takes over complete control over}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04091}04091 \textcolor{comment}{    memory in this library.}}

\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04216}04216 \textcolor{comment}{/* Editing text in this library is handled by either `nk\_edit\_string` or}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04217}04217 \textcolor{comment}{ * `nk\_edit\_buffer`. But like almost everything in this library there are multiple}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04218}04218 \textcolor{comment}{ * ways of doing it and a balance between control and ease of use with memory}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04219}04219 \textcolor{comment}{ * as well as functionality controlled by flags.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04220}04220 \textcolor{comment}{ *}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04221}04221 \textcolor{comment}{ * This library generally allows three different levels of memory control:}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04222}04222 \textcolor{comment}{ * First of is the most basic way of just providing a simple char array with}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04223}04223 \textcolor{comment}{ * string length. This method is probably the easiest way of handling simple}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04224}04224 \textcolor{comment}{ * user text input. Main upside is complete control over memory while the biggest}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04225}04225 \textcolor{comment}{ * downside in comparison with the other two approaches is missing undo/redo.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04226}04226 \textcolor{comment}{ *}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04227}04227 \textcolor{comment}{ * For UIs that require undo/redo the second way was created. It is based on}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04228}04228 \textcolor{comment}{ * a fixed size nk\_text\_edit struct, which has an internal undo/redo stack.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04229}04229 \textcolor{comment}{ * This is mainly useful if you want something more like a text editor but don't want}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04230}04230 \textcolor{comment}{ * to have a dynamically growing buffer.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04231}04231 \textcolor{comment}{ *}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04232}04232 \textcolor{comment}{ * The final way is using a dynamically growing nk\_text\_edit struct, which}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04233}04233 \textcolor{comment}{ * has both a default version if you don't care where memory comes from and an}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04234}04234 \textcolor{comment}{ * allocator version if you do. While the text editor is quite powerful for its}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04235}04235 \textcolor{comment}{ * complexity I would not recommend editing gigabytes of data with it.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04236}04236 \textcolor{comment}{ * It is rather designed for uses cases which make sense for a GUI library not for}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04237}04237 \textcolor{comment}{ * an full blown text editor.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l04238}04238 \textcolor{comment}{ */}}

\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l06036}06036 \textcolor{comment}{    For square root nuklear uses the famous fast inverse square root:}}

\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l06040}06040 \textcolor{comment}{    nuklear's use cases. IMPORTANT: this requires float format IEEE 754}}

\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l06042}06042 \textcolor{comment}{    Sine/Cosine}}

\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l06044}06044 \textcolor{comment}{    All constants inside both function are generated Remez's minimax}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l06045}06045 \textcolor{comment}{    approximations for value range 0...2*PI. The reason why I decided to}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l06046}06046 \textcolor{comment}{    approximate exactly that range is that nuklear only needs sine and}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l06047}06047 \textcolor{comment}{    cosine to generate circles which only requires that exact range.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l06048}06048 \textcolor{comment}{    In addition I used Remez instead of Taylor for additional precision:}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{nuklear_8h_source_l06049}06049 \textcolor{comment}{    www.lolengine.net/blog/2011/12/21/better-\/function-\/approximations.}}
